SAQUINAVIR

PROTEASE INHIBITORS

  • Indications and doses
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Patient and carer advice
  • Monitoring requirements
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

HIV infection in combination with other antiretrovirals in patients previously treated with antiretroviral therapy—with low-dose ritonavir,

By mouth

  • For adults
    1 g every 12 hours.

HIV infection in combination with other antiretrovirals in patients not previously treated with antiretroviral therapy—with low-dose ritonavir,

By mouth

  • For adults
    500 mg every 12 hours for 7 days, then increased to 1 g every 12 hours.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Manufacturer advises caution in moderate impairment; avoid in decompensated liver disease.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Use with caution if eGFR less than 30 mL/minute/1.73 m2.

Contra indications

  • Bradycardia
  • congenital QT prolongation
  • electrolyte disturbances
  • heart failure with reduced left ventricular ejection fraction
  • history of symptomatic arrhythmias
  • predisposition to cardiac arrhythmias

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Alopecia, changes in libido, dry mouth, dyspnoea, increased appetite, peripheral neuropathy,

uncommon: Convulsions, mucosal ulceration, renal impairment, visual impairment,

Advice for patients and carers

Arrhythmias

Patients should be told how to recognise signs of arrhythmia and advised to seek medical attention if symptoms such as palpitation or syncope develop.

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

Monitor ECG before starting treatment (do not initiate treatment if QT interval over 450 milliseconds); if baseline QT interval less than 450 milliseconds, monitor ECG during treatment (particularly 10 days after starting treatment in patients not previously treated with antiretroviral therapy)—discontinue if QT interval increases over 480 milliseconds, if QT interval more than 20 milliseconds above baseline, if prolongation of PR interval, or if arrthymias occur.

Prepared medicinal forms of SAQUINAVIR

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Tablet
